briefdescription.para: Style odd numbered columns.

Headers shown on all frames.
No headers shown for table.
Controls where headers are shown in the table.
Text which doesn't fit inside the cell is truncated.
Text which doesn't fit inside the cell is wrapped. Note that this only applies to text in columns with a fixed width.

Returns the color used for the background of the table.
Returns the margin distance between cell borders and their contents in mm.
Returns the cell style for a cell group.
Returns a reference to the list of QgsLayoutTableColumns shown in the table.
Returns the font used to draw text in table body cells.

Returns the behavior mode for empty tables.

detaileddescription.para:
This property controls how the table is drawn if it contains no content rows.
setEmptyTableBehavior()

briefdescription.para: Returns the message for empty tables with no content rows.

detaileddescription.para:
This message is displayed in the table body if the empty table behavior is set to ShowMessage.
setEmptyTableMessage()
emptyTableBehavior()

briefdescription.para: Returns the fixed size for a frame, if desired.

detaileddescription.para:
If the fixed frame size changes, the sizes of all frames can be recalculated by calling recalculateFrameRects().
frameIndex
frame number
fixed size for frame. If the size has a width or height of 0, then the frame size is not fixed in that direction and frames can have variable width or height accordingly.
minFrameSize()
recalculateFrameRects()

briefdescription.para: Fetches the contents used for the cells in the table.

simplesect.para: true if table contents were successfully retrieved.

parameterdescription.para: QgsLayoutTableContents to store retrieved row data in

briefdescription.para: Returns the color used for grid lines in the table.
Returns the width of grid lines in the table in mm.
Returns the font used to draw header text in the table.
Returns the color used to draw header text in the table.
Returns the horizontal alignment for table headers.
Returns the text used in the column headers for the table.

simplesect.para: QMap of int to QString, where the int is the column index (starting at 0), and the string is the text to use for the column's header

briefdescription.para: Returns the display mode for headers in the table.

detaileddescription.para:
This property controls if and where headers are shown in the table.
setHeaderMode()

briefdescription.para: Returns whether the grid's horizontal lines are drawn in the table.
Returns the minimum size for a frames, if desired.

detaileddescription.para:
If the minimum size changes, the sizes of all frames can be recalculated by calling recalculateFrameRects().
frameIndex
frame number
minimum size for frame. If the size has a width or height of 0, then the frame size has no minimum in that direction.
fixedFrameSize()
recalculateFrameRects()

memberdef.argsstring: (const QDomElement &itemElem, const QDomDocument &doc, const QgsReadWriteContext &context) override
memberdef.name: readPropertiesFromElement

briefdescription.para: Sets multiframe state from a DOM element.

detaileddescription.para:
element
is the DOM element for the multiframe
document
DOM document
context
read write context
writePropertiesToElement() Note that item subclasses should not rely on all other items being present in the layout at the time this method is called. Instead, any connections and links to other items must be made in the finalizeRestoreFromXml() method. E.g. when restoring a scalebar, the connection to the linked map's signals should be implemented in finalizeRestoreFromXml(), not readPropertiesFromElement().

briefdescription.para: Renders a portion of the multiframe's content into a render context.

visible extent of content to render into the painter.
frame number for content

parameterdescription.para: destination painter for grid lines
index corresponding to first row shown in frame
index corresponding to last row shown in frame. If greater than the number of content rows in the table, then the default row height will be used for the remaining rows.
set to true to include for the table header

QMap of int to double, where the int contains the column number and the double is the maximum width of text present in the column.
index corresponding to first row shown in frame

Calculates a range of rows which should be visible in a given frame.

parameterdescription.para: index number for frame

memberdef.argsstring: (double frameHeight, int firstRow, bool includeHeader, bool includeEmptyRows) const
memberdef.name: rowsVisible

briefdescription.para: Calculates how many content rows would be visible within a frame of the specified height.

parameterdescription.para: height of frame
index of first row visible in frame (where 0 = first row in table)
set to true if frame would include a header row

set to true to also include rows which would be empty in the returned count. For instance, if the frame would include all table content rows and have space left for extra rows then setting this parameter to true would also include a count of these extra blank rows.

simplesect.para: number of visible content rows (excluding header row)

memberdef.argsstring: (int frameIndex, int firstRow, bool includeEmptyRows) const
memberdef.name: rowsVisible

briefdescription.para: Calculates how many content rows are visible within a given frame.

parameterdescription.para: index number for frame
index of first row visible in frame (where 0 = first row in table)

set to true to also include rows which would be empty in the returned count. For instance, if the frame would include all table content rows and have space left for extra rows then setting this parameter to true would also include a count of these extra blank rows.

simplesect.para: number of visible content rows (excludes header rows)

briefdescription.para: Returns total height of table contents.
Returns total width of table contents.
Returns the calculated background color for a row and column combination.

parameterdescription.para: row number, where -1 is the header row, and 0 is the first body row
column number, where 0 is the first column

simplesect.para: background color, or invalid QColor if no background should be drawn

briefdescription.para: A class to display a table in the print layout, and allow the table to span over multiple frames.
